Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2011 08:02PM alliesmom15 wrote: I am post surgery, I had a double masectomy with one nipple sparing and reconstructive surgery at the same time.  My lymph nodes are clear. From the day of my Mammo to the day of the surgery it has been two weeks time.  I am really unclear at what my next step is, it has gone so fast.  I am cancer free.  I am seeing my oncologist next week and I dont want to do any chemo.  Has anyone else had it all this fast??

Posts.Title: It has spead to my brain...... jenn3 lwd

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2011 01:08AM alliesmom15 wrote: I am sorry, that is just unacceptable!  I would be demanding the dr to call me right away from home or cell phone, it is not fair that you have to wait so long, who cares if they think you are a pain, it is your life!! I was fortunate, my surgeon found out the results the day after my biopsy, called me, then gave me his personal cell phone number in case I needed anything else.
Posts.Title: BI RADS 5 Rockysg1 22lifeisgood

Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2011 07:11AM alliesmom15 wrote: I had my first mammogram May 13th and the report said it was a bi rad 5.  I knew it was BC but I held out hope that it wasnt.  They told me I had a 5% chance it wasnt.   By the time the biopsy came back I already had resigned my self that it was so wasnt as suprised knowing I actually had it.  From the time of the mammogram till I had my masectomy was only two weeks time so it didnt even feel like I had cancer.  It was recommended I see an oncologist so I went to two different ones and my surgeon had a round table discussion with himself, an ocologist, a pathologist and a radiologist.  Between the group and the two other oncologists the majority said I needed no further treatment.  It wasnt easy but we got through it and you will too.  I feel very fortunate that I caught it so early and know it could have been so much worse than it was.  I am healing and have so many people surrounding me with their love and support.  You came to the right place, these ladies know what you are going through.  Much Love  XOXOXO
Posts.Title: BI RADS 5 Rockysg1 22lifeisgood

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2011 12:13PM alliesmom15 wrote: My right side where the cancer was is the one that hurts, the left feels fine, little sore but healing nicely.  They didnt cut into my armpits on the left either just the right.    Scary that there is such a thing as the pain syndrome, hope it feels better eventually.

Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2011 03:25PM alliesmom15 wrote: I did not have the fat grafting for that purpose but did have some auxillary web syndrome pain.  I really worked with massage and stretching that helped. I had the fat transfers a week ago and they look so good, she also filled in the tight spot between the implant and where he took out the lymph nodes where there was a huge dent. Now it looks like the other side. Good luck :)
